entry.title: [SQ] I visited every Scandinavian country last month and would go out to at least one
entry.content: I visited every Scandinavian country last month and would go out to at least one nice restaurant in each capital. Multiple (three or four) times we were asked if we had a reservation which we didn't (we were winging the whole trip). The host would then get in a huff, say they needed to check if they could squeeze us in, then reluctantly seat us. We'd have our dinner and the restaurant never got above 50% full. Only time I get that in the US is when I walked in to an obviously slammed place or 30 min. before the rush and it's obvious it's going to fill up. Is this an actual thing or did I just get some selection bias?
